ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient's symptoms of amyloidosis of peripheral nerves, chronic diarrhea, and chronic constipation closely match the phenotypic features of hereditary systemic amyloidosis 6, as seen in the similar reference cases.

This subtype of hereditary systemic amyloidosis can also present with peripheral neuropathy and gastrointestinal symptoms, though it is less commonly associated with the exact combination seen in the patient.
Another subtype of hereditary systemic amyloidosis that may present with peripheral neuropathy and gastrointestinal issues, though the specific phenotype is less commonly documented.
Familial amyloid polyneuropathy can present with peripheral neuropathy and gastrointestinal symptoms, though the chronic constipation is less commonly reported compared to diarrhea.
This subtype may present with peripheral neuropathy and gastrointestinal symptoms, but it is less commonly associated with the exact combination seen in the patient.
